RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Sou pуs-doutorando em filosofia na Universidade de Sгo Paulo (USP/FAPESP) com um projeto sobre "A influкncia da filosofia kantiana na origem dos textos inйditos e publicados de Georges Canguilhem (com uma hipуtese sobre a gкnese da filosofia de Gйrard Lebrun)". Possuo pуs-doutorado no IHPST de Paris (2019), no CIRST de Montrйal (2020), na Universitй du Quйbec а Montrйal (2020), doutorado em Filosofia - Universitй Montpellier 3, Franзa (2015), mestrado em Filosofia e teoria da comunicaзгo - Universitб della Calabria, Itбlia (2010) e graduaзгo em Filosofia e teoria da comunicaзгo - Universitб della Calabria, Itбlia (2005). Tenho experiкncia na бrea da Filosofia, com кnfase na filosofia da ciкncia, na filosofia da biologia, na filosofia da medicina, na epistemologia, na filosofia da linguagem e na estйtica.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduation at Filosofia e teoria da comunicaзгo from Universitб della Calabria (2005), master's at Filosofia e teoria da comunicaзгo from Universitб della Calabria (2010) and doctorate at Filosofia from Universitй Montpellier 3 (2015). Has experience in Philosophy, focusing on Philosophy

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Faculdade de Filosofia Letras e Ciкncias Humanas

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: A influкncia da filosofia kantiana na origem dos textos inйditos e publicados de Georges Canguilhem (com uma hipуtese sobre a gкnese da filosofia de Gйrard Lebrun)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Esse projeto, cuja ideia central nasce dos resultados das nossas pesquisas doutorais na Franзa, pretende investigar as origens teуricas do pensamento do filosofo francкs Georges Canguilhem (1904-1995). Tradicionalmente, Canguilhem й considerado como discнpulo de Gaston Bachelard, jб que ele foi seu sucessor na cбtedra de filosofia e histуria das ciкncias na Sorbonne. Recentes estudos, conduzidos em particular por Camille Limoges e Xavier Roth, tкm porйm indicado: 1) que teoricamente Canguilhem nгo foi um discнpulo de Bachelard; 2) que Canguilhem, de um ponto de vista tanto teуrico quanto biogrбfico, foi aluno do filуsofo Alain (pseudфnimo de Йmile-Auguste Chartier, 1868-1951), exponente da Йcole de l?activitй, cujo ensino era baseado na transmissгo dos princнpios do kantismo. Em particular, segundo Roth, a obra de Canguilhem sofre nfluкncia de Kant atй 1939, ano do "dйtour", o ponto de viragem teуrico autфnomo.
Sem querer negar a originalidade do pensamento canguilhemiano, nosso projeto pretende demostrar a clara persistкncia da influкncia kantiana tambйm depois de 1939, com base nгo apenas nos textos publicados, mas tambйm de uma crescente quantidade de material inйdito (manuscritos, anotaзхes de cursos, cartas privada de Canguilhem, etc.), que nуs tivemos a oportunidade de analisar durante nosso estбgio de doutoramento no Centre d'Archives en Philosophie, Histoire et Edition des Sciences (CAPHЙS) de Paris ? centro de documentaзгo sob a tutela do Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique (CNRS) e da Йcole Normale Supйrieure (Paris). 
Na obra do filosofo Gйrard Lebrun, discнpulo de Canguilhem, e docente na Universidade de Sгo Paulo por muitos anos, й possнvel encontrar algumas semelhanзas teуricas em comum entre Kant e Canguilhem pуs-1939. Contando com a cooperaзгo de reconhecidos estudiosos da obra do autor francкs, entre as quais os prуprios Limoges e Roth, com esse projeto gostaria de me integrar nas pesquisas do Departamento de Filosofia da Universidade de Sгo Paulo, sobretudo no que diz respeito а uma tradiзгo que remonta ao ensino de Lebrun sobre a filosofia kantiana e o kantismo, no qual, como se espera mostrar, hб traзos oriundos das reflexхes canguilhemianas.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
This project, which stems from the findings of our PhD researches in France, aims to shed light on the theoretical origins of the thought of the French philosopher Georges Canguilhem (1904-1995). Traditionally, Canguilhem is considered to be a disciple of Gaston Bachelard, due to the fact that the latter was his predecessor at the chair of Philosophy and History of Science at the Sorbonne. However, recent studies, conducted in particular by Camille Limoges and Xavier Roth, have pointed out: 1) that Canguilhem was not, from a purely theoretical point of view, a disciple of Bachelard; 2) that Canguilhem, from a theoretical and also biographical point of view, was instead a disciple of the philosopher Alain, exponent of the ?Ecole de l?activitй?, whose teaching consisted mainly in the transmission of the principles of Kantism. In particular, according to Roth, Canguilhem's work is heavily influenced by Kant until 1939, the year when the philosopher?s thought undergoes a ?dйtour?, i.e. a turning point towards theoretical autonomy. 
Although we don't want to deny the theoretical originality of Canugilhemian thought, our project aims to demonstrate the marked persistence of the aforementioned Kantian influence even after 1939, on the basis of published texts and of a large amount of unpublished material in our possession, which was analysed at the CAPHЙS of Paris during our PhD (manuscripts, course notes, private letters, etc...). 
Indeed, the French philosopher Gйrard Lebrun, a disciple of Canguilhem and professor at USP for six years, showed some theoretical similarities that bind Kant and the post-1939 works of Canguilhem. By means of this project, which can take advantage of the collaboration of many international prominent academics, including the aforementioned Limoges and Roth, we would like to join the researchers of the USP philosophy department, who, thanks to their efforts on Kant and Kantism, are pursuing the ancient philosophical legacy of Lebrun and therefore, in our opinion, of Canguilhem.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The Influence of Kant's Philosophy at the Origin of the Unpublished and Published Texts of Georges Canguilhem (with a hypothesis about the genesis of Gйrard Lebrun's philosophy)

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Institut d'histoire et de philosophie des sciences et des techniques

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: From the end of metaphysics to the conception of the organism: Kant, Lebrun and Canguilhem.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Our main postdoctoral project aims to deepen, especially from a philosophical point of view, the Kant-Canguilhem-Lebrun theoretical lineage. In the light of the studies on philosophy and biology of our research group at the USP, with a first research period (6 months) at the IHPST in Paris under the direction of the Professor Philippe Huneman (last pupil of Lebrun), we would like to fortify the theoretical link between Kant, Canguilhem and Lebrun, proving that these three authors have in common not only a certain philosophy in the general sense, but also a well-defined conception of the philosophy of biology, according to which the living organism is characterized by an idea of internal finality. This conception breaks with the traditional idea of metaphysics, according to which the living being has its own reason for being in an external finality.

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Centre interuniversitaire de recherche sur la science et la technologie

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Action, thought and organism: from Kant to Canguilhem via Alain.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Our main postdoctoral project aims to deepen the Kant-Canguilhem-Lebrun theoretical lineage. After a period of research at the IHPST of Paris with a Kant and Lebrun specialist (Huneman), with a second research period (6 months) at the CIRST of Montrйal (founded by Camille Limoges) we would like to study with Vincent Guillin, who is interested in the links between Canguilhem, Kant, the Ecole rйflexive (Lachelier, Lagneau, Alain) and Descartes. In particular, demonstrating 1) that the master of Canguilhem (Alain) had transmitted to his pupil the Cartesian and Kantian principle of the antecedent of practical action with respect to abstract rules of thought and 2) that Canguilhem unlike Descartes and Alain applies this principle to the idea of organism, defining it as a biological principle, we would like to advance a thesis that the organism, in Canguilhem's philosophy, does not respond to an external finality (mechanical rules) but to an internal finality, i.e. precisely to a biological principle.
